meanings.definition: Ragtag - a motley assortment or group of people or things
meanings.sent1: The ragtag group of toys in the box included a teddy bear, a toy car, and a plastic dinosaur.
meanings.sent2: The team was a ragtag of students from different grades who came together for the science fair.
meanings.sent3: The ragtag collection of mismatched socks in the drawer seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a ragtag of colorful flowers, each one unique and beautiful in its own way.
meanings.sent5: The ragtag of books on the shelf ranged from mystery novels to cookbooks, creating a diverse collection.

meanings.definition: Ragtag - shabby, unkempt, or disorganized in appearance
meanings.sent1: The old house had a ragtag roof with missing shingles and peeling paint.
meanings.sent2: The stray cat had a ragtag appearance with its matted fur and dirty paws.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ragtag outfit, he managed to charm everyone at the party with his witty jokes.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned building stood in the moonlight, its ragtag windows reflecting the eerie glow.
meanings.sent5: The ragtag garden shed leaned to one side, its weathered wood blending into the overgrown grass.
